modName: Lind's Green Wizard Robes Revamp - Texture Replacer
summary: High-quality texture replacer for the Green long robes (Male and Female) featuring 2048x2048 textures for both the robes and the hood.
descriptionHtml:
[center]-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Description + Installation:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b]
This is a texture replacer for the Green long robes (Male and Female) featuring 2048x2048 textures for both the robes and the hood.
Installation: Simply Unzip and copy the Data folder in your Skyrim directory. [u]Compatible with edited meshes for every body replacer.[/u] Be mindful that excessively skimpy meshes may distrupt the textures.
The .dds files should end up into Data/textures/clothes/monk[/b]
Overwrite if asked.


[center][size=2][/size][center][b][size=2][size=3][i]My other works:[/i][/size]

[/size][/b][size=2][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74948/?]Lind's Elven Eyes - 40+ New High-Res Eyes[/url][/i][i]
[url=http://imgur.com/gallery/XhNq8]Lind's Human Eyes - 50+ New High-Res Eyes[b][/b][/url][b]

Standalone Robes[/b]:

[/i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74242/?][i]Lind's Standalone Robes Pack 01[/i]
[/url]

[b][i]Robes Texture Replacers:[/i][/b][/size][/center][size=2]
[/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72751/?]Robes of Vaermina[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71249/?]Black - The Warlock[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36817/?]Monk - Priest of the Divines[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70920/?]Green - The Bosmer Mage[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59734/?]Blue - Court Wizard[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59769/?]Brown - The Wandering Wizard[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36173/?]Grey - The Moth Priest[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/36049/?]Necromancer Robes - The King of Worms[/url]

[url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/]You can stay updated on what I'm doing through my Tumblr.

[img]http://s18.postimg.org/gnyqvvwll/Tumblr_Lind.jpg[/img][/url]

For those of you who don't fancy Tumblr, [url=https://twitter.com/LindsRealm] I just made this.

[img]https://s24.postimg.org/qey3j9tp1/Twitter.png[/img][/url][url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/][/url][/center]

[center] -----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]More Informations:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------
[img]http://s2.postimg.org/ta7k2znqx/Green_Pre.jpg[/img]


[youtube]AdBfmRQtjfU[/youtube]
Show this guy some love, this video is amazing.

So here's my Green Robes.
As usual I did my homework and researched which NPCs wear it before coming up with a texture, and guess what. In vanilla nobody does.
If you have Interesting NPCs installed though, you may be interested in knowing that Eldawyn, the Altmer pyromancer in Whiterun wears them.

So I thought, they're green robes right? Why not make them the Bosmer Mage Robes, after all there's not really much you can do to customize an elven mage in vanilla.
Now, dark green is a pretty strong colour visually-wise so the idea was to have a plain beige jacket-like upper
robe covering a gown which reminded of a leafy texture, to
somewhat soften the impact on the eye.

10/29/2015
[img]http://s14.postimg.org/6omhw9htt/Green_Hot_Files.jpg[/img]
Yeah!



-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Features over Vanilla[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------

[youtube]PbNRUIUo5yM[/youtube]
Green Robes at 1:06[/center]

The new textures have overall improved overall visuals:

-2k Textures (2048x2048)
-Completely New Hood.
-Completely re-made and recoloured (Tan and Green, with sand-coloured trim and ornaments).
-General shading and 3d effects.
-Re-Made the stitching.
-Re-shaded/coloured.
-Added layered effects.
-A cloth-like pattern covers the robes in order to give it a more realistic feeling.
-Added various elf-themed ornaments and decorations.
-Remade the rope-belt
-High resolution makes the texture [u]very[/u] hard to deform.

[center]-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Credits:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]

Halofarm's Poser.
Aloe's Poser.
Bethesda, because Skyrim.
exeter for adapting the vanilla mesh to UNP.

Thank you for your donations, it was unexpected, but I really appreciated it. (:[/i]

[i]I'd love to add donators to the credits to show my appreciation, problem
being through Paypal I can only see your name, not the username, so [u]message me if you'd like to be added![/u][/i][u]
[/u][u]
[/u][/center]
